noun.description: The fact or condition of being infested with insects or other bugs; characterized by the presence of a large number of these.
Computing. Of software: the fact or condition of being prone to malfunction due to programming errors or flaws; the fact or condition of containing many bugs.

origin: Mid 18th century; earliest use found in Nathan Bailey (d. 1742), lexicographer and schoolmaster. From buggy + -ness.
